info.title: Paycor Public API v1
info.description: Welcome to Paycor's Public API! This document is a reference for the APIs Paycor has available, and acts as a complement to the "Guides" section. # Getting Started To learn more about getting started with Paycor's Public APIs, check out our Guides. # GET, PUT, POST, PATCH * When requesting object, use GET endpoints. All list endpoints support paging, as described [in the other doc]. * When creating an object, use POST endpoints. Your code will need to create an object and send it to Paycor in your API call request body as JSON. You can use the "request sample" body as a starting point. Our endpoints will return a reference to the created object (the ID and GET API URL) for your system. * When updating an object, you will use PUT endpoints. The general flow would be to: GET the object you want to update, modify the fields as desired, then PUT the object (as JSON in the request body) to our endpoints. Some fields like the object's ID cannot be updated because they are system-set. * PATCH - partial update to existing resource # Error Handling * 202 - Response to a successful request that has been received and accepted for processing, but processing has not yet been completed * 400: Please consult the response text to correct your request information. * 401 with response "Access denied due to missing subscription key": Please include your APIM Subscription Key as header Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key or querystring parameter subscription-key. * 401 with no response: Please ensure you included a valid & current Access Token in the Authorization header. * 403: Please ensure your Access Token's scope has all the relevant access you need, on the AppCreator Data Access screen. * 404: Please validate the API route you are using. If that is correct, one of your IDs most likely does not exist or is not in a valid state. * 429: Paycor implements rate limits for our Public API. Each customer (implemented via APIM subscription key) has a limited number of calls. The number of calls is counted across all APIs, not per individual API. Please use bulk endpoints where available and spread your calls over a wider timespan. * The default rate limit is up to 1000 API calls per minute (total across all our Public APIs). * 500: Please contact Paycor. When you make a POST or PUT call and receive a 500, please do not retry the call automatically - this may result in double-posting. GETs can be safely retried. # IDs * ClientId = LegalEntityId * TenantId = CompanyId * EmployeeId is not visible in Paycor's UI, you must retrieve it from the Public API # Earnings, Deductions, Taxes This section describes the domain model for Paycor's Earnings, Deductions, and Taxes. This will provide background for many paydata-related Public API endpoints. Paycor stores Earnings, Deductions, and Taxes each at three levels: * Global: Same data across all legal entities. Setup by Paycor for customers to choose from. Sample Codes (note these will not be setup on every Legal Entity): * Earnings: REG, OT * Taxes: FITWH, SOC, SOCER, OHCIN * Deductions: 401k, KMat, H125, UWay * Legal Entity or Tenant: Codes setup & customized on the legal entity or Tenant level. Must be tied to a Global Code.. * Perform UI allows creating Deduction and Earning codes on Tenant level (under Configure Company nav menu). These will be returned by the Legal Entity Public API endpoints. * Employee: codes setup on a particular employee, tied to a Legal Entity-level or Tenant-level code * Employee Earnings/Deductions/Taxes are applied during payroll. Many properties are inherited from the Legal Entity or Global levels, but some can be overridden. # Authentication

get.summary: Get Employee Pay Schedule by EmployeeID
get.description:
This API will return upcoming pay scheduled for a given employee (upcoming check dates),
or allow looking up the check date for specific pay period dates.
* You must either specify the exact Period Start & End Date, or leave them blank. 
  * Alternatively you may consider 'GET Legal Entity Pay Schedule' which takes a range parameter.
  * You can look up pay period dates from 'GET Legal Entity Pay Schedule' (scheduled dates) or 'GET Legal Entity Pay Data' (actual dates)
* The actual pay dates may change depending on when the client admin processes payroll.

Data Access: View Employee Pay Schedule
get.operationId: Get Employee Pay Schedule by EmployeeID

parameters.name: employeeId
parameters.description: ID of the Employee for which you want to get the Pay Schedule

parameters.name: periodStartDate
parameters.description: Exact Period Start Date of Pay Schedule, to lookup specific payrun.

parameters.name: periodEndDate
parameters.description: Exact Period End Date of Pay Schedule, if you wish to filter - defaults to showing upcoming (future) runs

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: Token to get the next set of Employee Pay Schedule

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Options to include more data: Additional Runs

200.description: Returns a collection of Employee's Pay Schedules based on EmployeeID and filters provided

get.summary: Get Legal Entity Employees Time Card Punches by Legal Entity ID
get.description:
This pulls Punches data from Paycor's Perform Time system, for one legal entity.
* Clients *do not* need to run payroll before hours are returned by this endpoint.
* Our Public API currently does not include whether the hours have already been Approved or not.
* Time Card hours may be delayed by 20 minutes.
            
Date requirements=
* Start Date and End Date must not be more than one year ago
* Start Date must not be in future
* Start date and end date range can be no greater than 90 days
* Only dates will be considered, time will be set to 00=00=00 for start date and 23=59=59 for end date
            
Data Access= View Employee Time Card Punches By Legal Entity Id
            
Endpoint can only be used if the Client has the Perform Time Service
get.operationId: Get Employee Time Card Punches by Legal Entity Id

parameters.name: legalEntityId
parameters.description: ID of legal entity for which you want to get hours

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Date range filter, showing which records to return

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Date range filter, showing which records to return

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: Token to get next set of Employee Time Cards. ContinuationToken would be valid only for 24 hours. If a call is made after 24 hours with old continuationToken, no data will be retrieved.

200.description: Employee Time Card collection, based on Legal Entity Id and provided date ranges

post.summary: Post Time Off Requests By Legal Entity Id
post.description:
Data requirements=
* Accepts Maximum of 200 Objects in Request Body.
* StartTime and EndTime must not be more than one year ago.

Data Access= Add Timeoff Requests

Tip=
* It can take up to 5 minutes for successfully created Time Off Requests to return from the API.
* Use the Tracking ID for the timeoffRequests being created to check if there are any errors with the timeoffRequests.
* To check TimeoffRequests error logs by Legal Entity ID and Tracking ID, use the following GET endpoint= Get Employee Timeoff Request error logs by Legal Entity Id and Tracking Id
post.operationId: Post Employee Time Off Requests by Legal Entity ID

parameters.name: legalEntityId
parameters.description: ID of Legal Entity for which you want to add the Employee Time Off Requests

202.description: Returns a trackingId and ResourceUrl that could be used to find the status of this call

delete.summary: Delete Employee Time Off Requests by TimeOffRequestId
delete.description:
Tip=
* Ensure that the TimeOffRequestId provided is valid and exists in the system.        
* Maximum allowed number of records per request= 100
            
Data Access= Delete Employee Time Off Requests By Time Off Request Id

* Use the Tracking ID of the timeoffRequests being deleted to check if there are any errors with the timeoffRequests.
* To check TimeoffRequests error logs by Legal Entity ID and Tracking ID, use the following GET endpoint= Get Employee Timeoff Request error logs by Legal Entity Id and Tracking Id
delete.operationId: Delete Employees Time off Requests by TimeoffRequestId

parameters.name: employeeId
parameters.description: ID of the employee for which you want to delete Time Off Requests.

put.summary: Update Employee Time Off Requests by TimeOffRequestId
put.description:
Tip=
* Ensure that the TimeOffRequestId provided is valid and exists in the system.        
* Maximum allowed number of records per request= 100.
* Only pending TimeOffRequests can be approved or denied.
            
Data Access= Update Employee Time Off Requests By Time Off Request Id

* Use the Tracking ID for the timeoffRequests being updated to check if there are any errors with the timeoffRequests.
* To check TimeoffRequests error logs by Legal Entity ID and Tracking ID, use the following GET endpoint= Get Employee Timeoff Request error logs by Legal Entity Id and Tracking Id
put.operationId: Update Employees Time off Requests by TimeoffRequestId

parameters.name: employeeId
parameters.description: ID of the employee for which you want to update Time Off Requests.

PaycorError.description: The Paycor Error model is used to catch exceptions and related contextual data for logging.

correlationId.description: Correlation ID will help identify specific transactions and logs when troubleshooting.  This is generated by Paycor systems.

title.description: Title is friendly overall information that can be displayed to users.

detail.description: Gives more information to describe what the error is.
detail.example: A validation error occurred. See the source for more information about specific errors.

source.description: Specific details of the fields that have errors (when applicable).

PaycorRateLimitError.description: The Paycor Error model is used to catch exceptions and related contextual data for logging.

message.description: Message is friendly overall information that can be displayed to users.
message.example: Rate limit is exceeded. Try again in 60 seconds.

PagedResultOfJob.description:
The Paged Result model enables pagination of results if maximum of 100 records per response is exceeded. Additional
results can be requested by providing calling the AdditionalResultsUrl endpoint containing the continuation token, or
by building your own URL using the provided continuation token.

hasMoreResults.description: Whether additional API result records exist on the Paycor system.

continuationToken.description:
Paycor generated token string which may be provided in a subsequent request to  release additional records past the maximum. 
Used when partner is building their own URL.

additionalResultsUrl.description: Provides URL to call with the continuation token included for additional results.

records.description: List of the API response records.

id.description: Unique identifier of the Job in Paycor's system.

number.description: The job's human readable job number.

description.description: The job's description in HTML format.

status.description: Status of the job. Default is ACTIVE.

openings.description: The number of openings for the job.

internal.description: If the job is an internal only job.

timeToFill.description: The targeted time to fill the job.

eeoCategory.description: The EEO (Equal Employment Opportunity) category specification for the job. Can be one of these values: Executive/Senior-Level Officials and Managers, First/Mid-Level Officials and Managers, Professionals, Technicians, Sales Workers, Administrative Support Workers, Craft Workers, Operatives, Laborers and Helpers, Service Workers.

hiringManagers.description: The hiring managers assigned to the job.

recruiters.description: The recruiters assigned to the job.

teamMembers.description: The team members assigned to the job.

executives.description: The executives assigned to the job.

activatedDate.description: The date when the job was activated.

createdDate.description: The date when the job was created.

modifiedDate.description: The date when the job was last modified.

postedToCareers.description: Is the job posted to the company careers page.

postedToIndeed.description: Is the job posted to the free Indeed feed.

postedToSmartSourcing.description: Is the job posted to Smart Sourcing.

postedToLinkedIn.description: Is the job posted to the free LinkedIn.

postedToZipRecruiter.description: Is the job posted to the free ZipRecruiter feed.

postedToGravity.description: Is the job posted to Gravity.

id.description: Id of Job Location.

address1.description: Address Line One of Job Location.

address2.description: Address Line Two of Job Location.

id.description: Id of Job Department.
Id of the User.

Includes.description:
All - Include all data


    HiringManagers - Include the list of hiring managers in the response


    Recruiters - Include the list of recruiters in the response


    TeamMembers - Include the list of team members in the response


    Executives - Include the list of executives in the response

Includes2.description:
All - Include all data


    HiringManagers - Include the list of hiring managers in the response


    Recruiters - Include the list of recruiters in the response


    TeamMembers - Include the list of team members in the response


    Executives - Include the list of executives in the response

id.description: The candidate's ID

postalCode.description: The candidate's zip or postal code

createdDate.description: The date and time the candidate was created

modifiedDate.description: The date and time the candidate was recently modified

resourceUrl.description: URL to access the resource information about the entity that was created or updated.

ResourceReference.description: The Resource Reference model is used to provide URL links to resources.

id.description: ID of the resource being referenced. This is generated by Paycor.

url.description: URL to reach the resource being referenced

stage.description: The candidate's current hiring stage. Pass "0" for Passive Candidate and "1" for Job Seeker.

status.description:
The candidate's current hiring status. 
If "0" is passed to "Stage" property, then pass "0" for Recruiting Target, 
pass "1" for Confidental Resume, pass "2" for Employee Lead, pass "3" for Other, 
pass "9" for imported data. 
IF "1" is passed to "Stage" property, then pass "0" for Resume Bank, 
pass "1" for Site Applicant, pass "2" for Internal Referral, 
pass "3" for Posting Response, pass "4" for Agency Response, 
pass "5" for Other, pass "6" for Gravity Referral, pass "7" for Agency Referral

postalCode.description: The candidate's zip or postal code

RefreshToken.description: The OAuth2 refresh token that can be exchanged for access token.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token previously issued to the client.

client_id.description: OAuth Client Id. It can be read from Application page > Security Connections tab.

client_secret.description: OAuth Client Secret. It can be read from Application page > Security Connections tab.

PayrollCustomFieldsData.description: Represents payroll custom field values for a business entity.

payrollCustomValues.description: The collection of payroll custom field values for the business entity.

PayrollCustomValueRequest.description: Represents a payroll custom field value request.

name.description: The name of the custom field.

value.description: The value of the custom field.

PayrollCustomFieldValuesRequest.description: Represents the custom field values payload for a business entity in payroll.

entityTypeId.description: The identifier of the business entity type. This is the unique ID for a specific department or work location.

entityType.description: The business entity type. This defines whether the entity is a Department or Work Location.

payrollCustomValues.description: The collection of payroll custom field values for the business entity.

name.description: Name of the Company HR plan.

description.description: Description of the HR plan.

coverageLevelCode.description: Coverage level code for the plan.

isSelfInsuredPlan.description: Indicates if the plan is self-insured.

isMinimumValue.description: Indicates if the plan provides minimum value coverage.

type.description: Type of the plan.

effectiveDate.description:
Effective date when the plan starts.
Format= YYYY-MM-DDTHH=MM=SSZ (ISO-8601 standard)

effectiveUntil.description:
Date when the plan expires.
Format= YYYY-MM-DDTHH=MM=SSZ (ISO-8601 standard)

hrPlanKey.description: Unique key identifier for the HR plan.

selected.description: Indicates if the plan is selected.

hasSingleSplit.description: Indicates if the plan has a single split configuration.

coverageStartCode.description: Coverage start code for the plan.

coverageWaitNumber.description: Number of days to wait for coverage.

isSelected.description: Indicates if the plan is currently selected.

isPerEmployeeCost.description: Indicates if the cost is calculated per employee.

isMultipleEligibilityGroup.description: Indicates if the plan supports multiple eligibility groups.

providerPlanKey.description: Unique key for the provider's plan.

missingOneOrMoreNewHireRule.description: Indicates if one or more new hire rules are missing

isMinimumEssentialCoverage.description: Indicates if the plan provides minimum essential coverage.

firstName.description: First name of the emergency contact.

middleName.description: Middle name of the emergency contact.

lastName.description: Last name of the emergency contact.

relationship.description: Relationship of the emergency contact with the employee.

homePhone.description:
Home Phone of the emergency contact.
Must be 10 characters.

workPhone.description:
Work Phone of the emergency contact.
Must be 10 characters.

workPhoneExtension.description: Work Phone extension of the emergency contact.

mobilePhone.description:
Mobile Phone of the emergency contact.
Must be 10 characters.

emailAddress.description: Email Address of the emergency contact.

Relationship.description: Enumeration of valid Types of Relationship values.

EmployeeBenefit.description:
The Employee Benefit model represents Employee Benefit related information.
Provides information about the employee's benefit eligibility, classifications, and assignments.

legalEntityId.description: Unique identifier of the legal entity in Paycor's system.

employeeId.description: Unique identifier of the employee in Paycor's system.

primaryAssignment.description:
Primary assignment identifier for the employee.
If employee has multiple assignments/positions/profiles then this property provides the employeeId of the primary assigned profile. If given employeeId is also primary assigned profile then it returns the same Id.

benefitClassification.description: Primary benefit classification for the employee.

benefitClassificationDate.description: Date range information for when the benefit classification is effective.

benefitClassification1.description: First additional benefit classification for the employee.

benefitClassification2.description: Second additional benefit classification for the employee.

benefitClassification3.description: Third additional benefit classification for the employee.

BenefitClassificationDateRange.description: Represents the effective date range for a benefit classification.

effectiveStartDate.description:
Date when the benefit classification becomes effective.
Format= YYYY-MM-DDTHH=MM=SS (ISO-8601 standard)

effectiveEndDate.description:
Date when the benefit classification is no longer effective.
Format= YYYY-MM-DDTHH=MM=SS (ISO-8601 standard)

BenefitClassificationDetail.description: Represents detailed information for a benefit classification including field name, value, and effective dates.

effectiveStartDate.description:
Date when this classification becomes effective.
Format= YYYY-MM-DDTHH=MM=SS (ISO-8601 standard)

effectiveEndDate.description:
Date when this classification is no longer effective.
Format= YYYY-MM-DDTHH=MM=SS (ISO-8601 standard)
For active record, the default value is "9999-12-31T00=00=00".

EmployeeCustomField.description: Allows reading the value of a Custom Field set on a particular Employee.

customFieldId.description: Unique identifier of the Custom Field. Generated by Paycor.

legalEntityId.description: LegalEntityId that created the Custom Field.

fieldName.description: Name of the custom field, set at the Legal Entity level.

dataType.description: Data type for the custom field. Values submitted (in PUT Employee Custom Field) must be of this type.

value.description:
Value of the custom field set for this employee.
Expected Datatype could be string, float, or date - depending on the setup of the LegalEntity Custom Field.

isRequired.description: Whether this custom field is required to be setup on each Employee.

customFieldsOptions.description: Valid list of values for a custom field (for appropriate types)

dateModified.description: Date when custom field value was last modified.

employee.description: URL to access the Employees resource for information about the employee.

EmployeeCustomField2.description:
Allows upserting (inserting or updating) a value for a specific Custom Field on a specific Employee. 
Calling this twice will replace the previously-supplied value. 
You must first call GET Employee Custom Fields, to identify a CustomFieldId and the datatype for its Value.

customFieldId.description:
Unique identifier of the Custom Field, available via GET Employee Custom Fields. 
Used to lookup which field value to update on this employee. Generated by Paycor.

value.description:
Value of the custom field set for this employee.
Expected Datatype could be string, float, or date - depending on the setup of the LegalEntity Custom Field.

EmployeeDeduction.description:
The Employee Deduction model represents Employee level Deduction information.
Provides link to associated Employee information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the employee deduction in Paycor's system. Generated by Paycor.

code.description: Unique deduction code set at the legal entity or tenant level.

description.description: Description of the employee deduction code.

type.description: Enumeration of valid types of employee deduction values.

frequency.description: Enumeration of valid employee deduction frequency values.

includeInPay.description: Enumeration of valid values indicating which pay run should include the employee deduction.

onHold.description: Whether the employee deduction should be not deducted in a paycheck. This is specified by the 'Calculate' checkbox in the Paycor UI. Default is OnHold=false, meaning Calculate=true.

effectiveStartDate.description:
Date the employee deduction takes effect.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

effectiveEndDate.description:
Date the employee deduction is no longer in effect (soft-delete flag). Null if deduction is still in effect.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

amountData.description: List of type EmployeeDeductionAmount containing the employee's deduction rates and amounts.

limits.description: List of type EmployeeDeductionLimit containing the employee's deduction limit details.

employee.description: URL to access the Employee resource containing additional employee information.

legalEntityDeduction.description: URL to access the Legal Entity Deduction resource for information about the legal entity's deductions. Currently returns the list.

DeductionType.description: Enumeration of valid Types of Deduction values.

PayFrequency.description: Enumeration of valid Pay Frequency values.

IncludeInPay.description: Enumeration of valid IncludeInPay values indicating which pay run to include an Earning or Deduction.

EmployeeDeductionAmount.description: The Employee Deduction Amount model represents Employee Deductions Amount data.

id.description: ID of record

rate.description: Percentage value set by the user.

effectiveStartDate.description:
Date the employee deduction rates and amounts take effect.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

effectiveEndDate.description:
Date the employee deduction rates and amounts are no longer in effect (soft-delete flag). Null if still active.
Date is formatted as MM/DD/YYY

id.description: The unique identifier for the limit

frequency.description: Period associated with the limit (Year to date, Month to date, or Quarter to Date)

maxAmount.description: Maximum amount to withhold during the limit period

totalToWithhold.description: Limit to be paid over the life of the deduction

level.description: The hierarchy at which the limit is enforced

LimitFrequency.description: Enumeration of valid Limit Frequency values.

The Paged Result model enables pagination of results if maximum of 100 records per response is exceeded. Additional
results can be requested by providing calling the AdditionalResultsUrl endpoint containing the continuation token, or
by building your own URL using the provided continuation token.

hasMoreResults.description: Whether additional API result records exist on the Paycor system.

continuationToken.description:
Paycor generated token string which may be provided in a subsequent request to  release additional records past the maximum. 
Used when partner is building their own URL.

additionalResultsUrl.description: Provides URL to call with the continuation token included for additional results.

records.description: List of the API response records.

TaxFile.description: TaxFile represents an object that holds information about taxes.

employeeId.description: Unique identifier of the Employee in Paycor's system.

legalEntityId.description: Unique identifier of the legal entity in Paycor's system. This is also known as the Client Id.

taxDocumentURL.description: Resource url used for downloading the file.
taxDocumentURL.example: URL to access the Employee Tax document link

EmployeeInformation.description: Represents information related to an Employee for whom the Tax document has been requested for.

socialSecurityNumber.description: Social security number of the employee.

EmployeeEarning.description: A record of one specific earning that one particular employee has setup, including employee-specific details such as amount. Must be tied to an earning at the LegalEntity level.

id.description: Unique identifier of the employee earning in Paycor's system.

code.description: Descriptive earning identifier which appears on paychecks. Only set at the legal entity or tenant level.

description.description: Description of the employee earning code.

type.description: Enumeration of valid type of employee earning values.

frequency.description: Enumeration of valid Pay Frequency values.

sequenceNumber.description:
Order earnings are calculated based on sequence values.
This is needed so earnings dependent on other earnings are calculated in the proper sequence.

includeInPay.description: Enumeration of valid values indicating which pay run should include the employee earning.

onHold.description: Whether the employee earning should included in a paycheck. This is specified by the 'Calculate' checkbox in the Paycor UI.

effectiveStartDate.description:
Date the employee earning take effect.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

effectiveEndDate.description:
Date the employee earning is no longer in effect.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

amountData.description: List of the employee's earning rates, factors and amounts of type EmployeeEarningAmount.

employee.description: URL to access the Employees resource for information about the employee.

legalEntityEarning.description: URL to access the Legal Entity Earning resource for information about the legal entity's earnings.

EarningType.description: Enumeration of valid Types of Earning values.

EmployeeEarningAmount.description: The Employee Earning Amount model represents Employee Earning Amount data.

rate.description: Amount per hour the employee will obtain from this earning.

factor.description:
Multiplier used with the hourly rate to calculate other earnings.
Default value is 1, unless changed at the global level.

effectiveStartDate.description:
Date the employee earning rates and amounts take effect.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

effectiveEndDate.description:
Date the employee earning rates and amounts are no longer in effect.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

Includes5.description:
All - Include all data


    AmountData - Include amount data

ImportPayrollHours.description: Request body object for importing Payroll data into Paycor's Payroll system (not Time system).

integrationVendor.description: Required freeform field for tracking purposes. You can input your company or application name.

processId.description:
Unique identifier of the transaction to prevent double-posting in Paycor's systems. 
Please generate a new GUID (using any method) for every API call.
Use the same GUID only when you want to replace existing data.

importEmployees.description: List of Employees, with nested lists of Earnings, to import into Paycor's Paygrid system.

employeeNumber.description: Unique number of the employee in the tenant. You can use any GET Employee endpoint to retrieve.

importEarnings.description: List of Earnings for this Employee.

baseDepartmentCode.description: Department to be used when employee is being paid outside of their assigned payroll.  All scheduled earnings for this employee will be paid in this department.

ImportEarning.description: Employee-specific Payroll Import row for a specific working date range. Includes all Pay-related info.

departmentCode.description: Department code that the Hours should be paid under. You can use GET Legal Entity Departments to retrieve valid Code values.

earningCode.description: Employee's earning Code. You can retrieve via Get Employee Earnings endpoints.

earningHours.description: Number of hours that Employee worked.

earningRate.description: Dollar rate to assign to the earning.

dateWorked.description:
The date worked (associated with this earning).
Optional. May be used by clients who have Workweek calculation feature enabled or by specific partner integrations.

laborCodes.description: Optional. This allows supplying Labor Codes tied to this earning, used for Job Costing and other functionality.

payGroupId.description: Unique identifier of the pay group in Paycor's system. You can retrieve by calling 'Get Pay Groups by Legal Entity ID'

payNumber.description:
Optional, defaults to 1.
Indicates which paycheck for this employee the earning will appear on (essentially a sort order for the particular Employee).
Use sequential values such as 1, 2, 3...

clientDefinedValue.description: Optional. This field allows passing in additional information used by specific partner integrations.

LaborCode.description:
Labor Code (also called Job Code) is used for Job Costing functionality.
Note that both Category and Code are required in order to be unique.

category.description:
Job Category (also known as Labor Category) are used to organize Job Codes.
This feature is used for Job Costing support, which not all clients will use. Categories must be configured in advance by an HR Admin in Perform.
You can use GET Legal Entity Job Categories API to retrieve.

code.description:
Job Code is used for Job Costing functionality, to map paid amounts to a project.
You can use GET Legal Entity Job Codes APIs to retrieve. This field expects the Code, not the Labor Code Name.
Not all clients will use Job Costing.

EmployeePayRate.description:
The Pay Rates model represents information about the Employee's Pay Rate.
Provides link to the Employee's information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the employee pay rate in Paycor's system. Generated by Paycor.

effectiveStartDate.description:
Date when the employee pay rate takes effect.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

effectiveEndDate.description:
Date when the employee pay rate is no longer in effect, or NULL if rate is currently active.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

sequenceNumber.description: Orders how multiple earnings are calculated. Needed so earnings dependent on other earnings are calculated in the proper sequence.

payRate.description:
Employee's rate of pay (in dollars). 
If Pay Type is Hourly, then Pay Rate is a Per-Hour dollar amount and is required. 
If Pay Type is Salary, then Pay Rate is a Per-Pay dollar amount, and either Pay Rate or Annual Rate is required.
Payrate can't have more than 6 decimal places and can't be negative.

annualPayRate.description: Employee's annual amount of pay (in dollars).

description.description: Brief description of the employee's pay rate.

annualHours.description: Employee's annual working hours. Value defaults to 2080.

type.description:
Whether pay rate is: 
  * Hourly (in which case PayRate will be per-hour)
  * Salary (in which case PayRate will be per-pay)

reason.description: Reason associated with the employee's pay rate.

notes.description:
Notes associated with the employee's pay rate, which will be displayed on Pay Rate History page.  
There is a known bug and would be fixed in coming release. 
Value is always null due to existing issue and actual values in Paycor system may or may not be null based on the user input.

employees.description: URL to access the Employee resource for information about the employee.

PayType.description: Enumeration of valid Pay Type values.

EmployeePayRate2.description: The Create PayRate model represents Employee PayRate related information needed to create a new PayRate.

effectiveStartDate.description:
Represents the date that the payrate goes into effect. 
You can pass in future dates to take effect in future, or today's date to take effect immediately. 
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

effectiveEndDate.description:
Date when the employee pay rate is no longer in effect. Default to null. Only pass in a date if the payrate is no longer active.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

sequenceNumber.description:
Orders how multiple earnings are calculated. Needed so earnings dependent on other earnings are calculated in the proper sequence.
Must be unique and be ascending without gaps (ie 1, 2, 3). Use GET Payrates to identify existing sequences.

payRate.description:
Employee's rate of pay (in dollars). 
If Pay Type is Hourly, then Pay Rate is a Per-Hour dollar amount and is required. 
If Pay Type is Salary, then Pay Rate is a Per-Pay dollar amount, and either Pay Rate or Annual Rate is required.
Payrate can't have more than 6 decimal places and can't be negative.

annualPayRate.description:
Employee's annual pay amount (in dollars). Only used if Type=Salary. 
* For Salary Type, AnnualPayRate overrides payRate if passed into API call. The value not provided will be calculated based on Employee's Annual Hours setup on Employee's Profile.
* For Hourly Type, this parameter is ignored - Paycor calculates based on Employee's Annual Hours setup on Employee's Profile.

description.description:
Required. Brief description of the employee's pay rate. Defaults to "Rate {SequenceNumber}"
Must be 20 characters or less

type.description:
Whether pay rate is: 
  * Hourly (in which case PayRate will be per-hour)
  * Salary (in which case PayRate will be per-pay)

reason.description: Reason associated with the employee's pay rate. Optional.

notes.description:
Notes associated with the employee's pay rate, which will be displayed on Pay Rate History page. 
Must be 512 characters or less. Optional.

EmployeePayRate3.description: The Update PayRate model includes fields that can be updated on an existing PayRate.

effectiveStartDate.description:
Represents the date that the payrate goes into effect. 
PUT requires EffectiveStartDate value to be unique for this PayRateId.

sequenceNumber.description:
Orders how multiple earnings are calculated. Needed so earnings dependent on other earnings are calculated in the proper sequence.
For PUT, this should match an existing SequenceNumber (retrieved via GET Employee PayRates).

payRate.description:
Employee's rate of pay (in dollars). 
If Pay Type is Hourly, then Pay Rate is a Per-Hour dollar amount and is required. 
If Pay Type is Salary, then Pay Rate is a Per-Pay dollar amount, and either Pay Rate or Annual Rate is required.
Payrate can't have more than 6 decimal places and can't be negative.

annualPayRate.description:
Employee's annual pay amount (in dollars). Only used if Type=Salary. 
* For Salary Type, AnnualPayRate overrides payRate if passed into API call. The value not provided will be calculated based on Employee's Annual Hours setup on Employee's Profile.
* For Hourly Type, this parameter is ignored - Paycor calculates based on Employee's Annual Hours setup on Employee's Profile.

description.description:
Required. Brief description of the employee's pay rate. Defaults to "Rate {SequenceNumber}"
Must be 20 characters or less

type.description:
Whether pay rate is: 
  * Hourly (in which case PayRate will be per-hour)
  * Salary (in which case PayRate will be per-pay)

reason.description: Reason associated with the employee's pay rate. Optional.

notes.description:
Notes associated with the employee's pay rate, which will be displayed on Pay Rate History page. 
Must be 512 characters or less. Optional.

Adjusted hire date is used when the employee's hire date does not accurately reflect benefits eligibility because an employee may have left,
been rehired or taken a Leave of Absence. This provides an alternative date for the employee's accruals to be calculated on.
 Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

Date the employee was terminated.

 Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

Date on which the calculation of an employee's seniority is based.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

EmployeeContact.description:
The PUT EmployeeContact model allows updating Employee's Contact Information fields.
All fields are optional. Fields not supplied with a value will retain previous values.

homeEmail.description: Home Email Address of an employee.

workEmail.description: Work Email Address of an employee.

phones.description:
List of type Phone containing phone numbers of the employee.
Accepts Home, Mobile and Work phone numbers, upto 1 of each type.
Only the specific number types passed in will be updated, existing phone numbers will remain unchanged.

EmployeePositionAndStatus.description:
The PUT Employee Position And Status model allows updating Employee's Position and Status Information fields.
Employee Status fields are: EmploymentStatus and RehireDate. Both fields have to be set in order to update Employee Status.
Employee Position fields are: EmploymentType, WorkLocation, JobTitle, FLSA, ManagerId, DepartmentId. Fields EmployeeType and WorkLocation have to be set in order to update Employee Position.

rehireDate.description:
Re-hire date of the employee. Terminated employees can be rehired.
 Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

workLocation.description:
The name of the Work Location to associate with Employee.
 * Must be an existing Work Location, use Legal Entity Work Locations to retrieve a list of valid names.

jobTitle.description:
Name of the Job Title to associate with Employee.
 * Must be an existing Job setup on the Tenant. Use API 'GET Tenant Job Titles by TenantId' to retrieve a list of valid names.

flsa.description: Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) type value for employee (enumeration)

managerId.description:
Unique identifier of Employee in Paycor's system.
* Must be an existing Employee, use the EmployeeID provided from other GET Employee endpoints

departmentId.description:
Identifier of Department.
* Use API 'GET Legal Entity Departments by Legal Entity id' to retrieve a list of valid departments.

EmploymentStatus2.description: Enumeration of valid Employment Status Update values.

EmployeePosition.description: The PUT Employee Position model allows updating Employee's Position fields.

workLocation.description:
The name of the Work Location to associate with Employee.
 * Must be an existing Work Location. Use API 'GET Legal Entity Work Location by Legal Entity ID' to retrieve a list of valid names.

jobTitle.description:
Name of the Job Title to associate with Employee.
 * Must be an existing Job setup on the Tenant. Use API 'GET Tenant Job Titles by TenantId' to retrieve a list of valid names.
            If null, existing value is retained.

flsa.description:
Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) type value for employee (enumeration)
            If null, existing value is retained.

managerId.description:
Unique identifier of Employee in Paycor's system.
If null, existing value is retained.

departmentId.description:
Identifier of Department.
            If null, existing value is retained.

isFullTime.description:
Determines if an employee is Full Time or Part Time.
Values:
true: Employee is Full Time.
false: Employee is Part Time.
null: Existing value is retained.

EmployeeStatusUpdate.description: The Employee Status model to update Employee Status related data.

effectiveDate.description:
Date at which the employee status update takes effect.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

employeeStatus.description: Enumeration of valid employment status values.

employeeStatusReasonId.description: Unique Identifier for Employee Status Reason. All possible Status Reason Values can be found using Get Legal Entity Status Reason values endpoint.

eligibleForRehire.description: Determines if an employee is eligible for rehire after termination. This is required when EmployeeStatus is updated to one of these values: Deceased, LaidOff, Resigned, Retired, Terminated. Otherwise optional.

isVoluntaryByEmployee.description: Determines if an employee termination is voluntary or not.  This is required when EmployeeStatus is updated to one of these values: Deceased, LaidOff, Resigned, Retired, Terminated. Otherwise optional.

notes.description: Notes associated with the employee's status update, which will be stored in Employee's Status History.

EmployeeIdentifyingData.description:
The PUT EmployeeIdentifyingData model allows updating Employee's personal data fields.
All fields are required, except EmployeeNumber, Middle Name and Status.

suffix.description: Enumeration of valid name suffix values.

socialSecurityNumber.description: Social security number of the employee.

birthDate.description:
Date of birth of the employee.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

socialSecurityNumber.description: Social security number of the employee.

employeeId.description: Unique identifier of the employee in Paycor's system. Generated by Paycor.

employeeNumber.description: Unique number of the employee in the client.

birthDate.description:
Date of birth of the employee.

status.description: Employee status. Values are: Active and Inactive

EmployeesSearchResult.description: Represents collection of employees with same SSN.

match.description: Flag which determines existence of employees with requested SSN.

employees.description: Collection of employees with requested SSN.

id.description: Unique identifier of the employee in Paycor's system. Generated by Paycor.

EmployeeSearchRequest.description: Represents body of search request for Employees by Social Security Number.

legalEntityId.description: The unique identifier of the legal entity where we perform the search.

prefix.description: Enumeration of valid name prefix values.

suffix.description: Enumeration of valid name suffix values.

socialSecurityNumber.description: Social security number of the employee.

birthDate.description:
Date of birth of the employee following the ISO 8601 standard.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

legalEntityId.description: Legal Entity Id

exportedByEmailAddress.description: Email of the user exporting records

address1.description: First line of street address information.

address2.description: Additional line of street address information.

startDate.description:
Date the employement start.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

jobTitle.description: Name of the Job Title to associate with new hire.

departmentCode.description:
Code of the department in Paycor's system.
Can be retrieved by calling 'Get Legal Entity Departments by Legal Entity ID'

disability.description: Disabiilty Status of new hire employee (enumeration)

baseSalary.description: Base Salary of new hire employee

salaryFrequency.description: Salary Frequency of new hire employee

workLocationId.description: Worklocation Id of new hire employee

onboardingGroupName.description: This is the name of Onboarding group that is created at client level (this must be acquired via the UI of Paycor at this time). If OnboardingType is Invite, then this field is required or else the Onboarding Employee will be set to awaiting invite, if not passed, then the Onboarding Employee will be set to "AwaitingInvite" and need to be updated via the UI prior to the invite being sent.

inviteType.description: To send automatic invites it needs to be set to Invite, if no value is set, "Awaiting Invite" will be selected.

i9DelegateUserId.description: This is the ID acquired from GET I9 Delegate Users. For this field to be accepted, then InviteType needs to be Invite and OnboardingGroupName needs to be passed with a valid Group or else the Onboarding Employee will default to "AwaitingInvite".

workerType.description:
Determines if an employee is paid via Paycors payroll system or unpaid.
Options:
Paid: Default value if left empty or invalid.
Unpaid: Only if the client has the Unpaid Worker service enabled. Defaults to Paid if the service is not enabled.
Choose Unpaid for third-party paid or volunteer positions with no salary information.

isFullTime.description:
Determines if an employee is Full Time or Part Time.
Values:
True: Employee is Full Time.
False: Employee is Part Time.
Null: Selection can be made later during onboarding.

onboardingNotificationUserId.description:
The User Id of the person to be notified after a new hire is imported successfully.
Must be a valid, active Paycor User Id.
User must have a Hiring Role, Limited Hiring Role, or relevant hiring privileges.
User must have a valid email and/or phone number if notifications are sent via email or SMS, depending on client settings.
Invalid Guid, inactive UserId, or missing privileges will result in the user not being notified.

displayDate.description:
The date when the timecard was created.

Date and time when the employee punched in.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS

punchOut.description:
Date and time when the employee punched out.

This represents the Labor Category level the Labor Code is associated with.  
You can find the correlating Labor Category Level by calling GET Labor Categories 
by Legal Entity ID and matching on the "CategoryLevel" field (available values = 1-6).

laborCode.description: The labor code associated with the punch pair.

activityEndDate.description: Date range this time off balance record covers.

usedBalance.description: Number of hours used (spent) so far within this plan and date range.

comment.description: Additional comment for this time off request. Optional. Currently not available in Get Employee Time Off Requests by EmployeeId.

Status could be Pending, Approved, Denied, Removed, Canceled or empty

JsonInput.description:
Represents the input model for processing JSON data imports, including the data to be imported and the mapping configuration.
This model is used to facilitate the import of data in JSON format into a designated blob storage.

data.description: Gets or sets the input data in JSON format, structured as a list of dictionaries for processing imports.

mapName.description: Gets or sets the name of the mapping configuration used for processing the imports.

ReportDetail.description:
Represents the details of a report row returned from a file import operation,
including transaction information, row identifier, cancellation status, and any associated reasons.

transactionId.description: Gets or sets the unique identifier for the transaction.

rowId.description: Gets or sets the row identifier within the report.

isCancelled.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the row is cancelled.

reasonJson.description: Gets or sets the dictionary containing reason details for the row.

ReportDetailsPublic.description:
Represents the public details of a report returned from a file import operation,
including pagination information, transaction identifier, summary, and individual records.

hasMoreResults.description: Represents a value indicating whether there are more results available.

continuationToken.description: Represents the continuation token for paginated results.

transactionId.description: Represents the unique identifier for the transaction.

summary.description: Represents the summary information for the file import operation.

records.description: Represents the collection of report detail records.

ReportSummary.description:
Represents summary information for a file import operation,
including row counts, status, and file details.

totalRows.description: Represents the total number of rows processed.

totalSuccess.description: Represents the total number of successful rows.

totalFailed.description: Represents the total number of failed rows.

totalCancelled.description: Represents the total number of cancelled rows.

status.description: Represents the overall status of the import operation.

importType.description: Represents the type of import operation.

importFileName.description: Represents the name of the imported file.

ReportRecord.description:
Represents an individual record in the file import report,
including row identifier, cancellation status, and any associated error reasons.

rowId.description: Represents the row identifier within the report.

isCancelled.description: Represents a value indicating whether the row is cancelled.

errorReason.description:
Represents the dictionary containing error reason details for the row.
The key represents the field name and the value contains the error message.

PagedResultOfGeneralLedger.description:
The Paged Result model enables pagination of results if maximum of 100 records per response is exceeded. Additional
results can be requested by providing calling the AdditionalResultsUrl endpoint containing the continuation token, or
by building your own URL using the provided continuation token.

hasMoreResults.description: Whether additional API result records exist on the Paycor system.

continuationToken.description:
Paycor generated token string which may be provided in a subsequent request to  release additional records past the maximum. 
Used when partner is building their own URL.

additionalResultsUrl.description: Provides URL to call with the continuation token included for additional results.

records.description: List of the API response records.

LegalEntity.description:
The Legal Entity (Client) model represents organization Legal Entity information.
Provides links to the Legal Entity's associated Tenant, Employee, Person, Earning, Deduction, Taxes and Custom Field information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the legal entity in Paycor's system. This is also known as the Client Id.

taxFilingName.description: Tax Filing Name of the legal entity (special characters removed).

federalId.description: US Federal tax Identification Number/Employer Identification Number.

type.description: Enumeration of valid types of corporation values specifying how the legal entity is registered with the US government.

isLost.description:
Flag that shows is the client active in Paycor system.
Once a client is marked Lost, it will never reset to IsLost=false. A new LegalEntityId would be created instead

businessNames.description: List of type BusinessName containing the legal entity's name, addresses and types.

taxFilingBusinessNames.description: List of data of type Address containing all of the legal entity's business addresses with IRS rules applied.

tenant.description: URL to access the Tenant resource for information about the legal entity's tenant.

employees.description: URL to access the Employee resource for information about the legal entity's employees.

persons.description: URL to access the Person resource for person information for the employee.

earnings.description: URL to access the Earning resource for information about the legal entity's earnings.

deductions.description: URL to access the Deduction resource for information about the legal entity's deductions.

taxes.description: URL to access the Taxes resource for information about the legal entity's taxes.

settings.description: URL to access the Settings resource for information about the legal entity's settings.

CorporationType.description: Enumeration of valid Types of Corporation values.

BusinessName.description: The Business Name model represents Legal Entity Business Name information.

type.description: Type of the legal entity's business name.

addresses.description: List of data of type Address containing all of the legal entity's business addresses.

BusinessNameType.description: Enumeration of valid Types of Business Name values.

LegalEntityAddress.description: The Legal Entity Address model represents Legal Entity Address information.

streetLine1.description: First line of street address information.

streetLine2.description: Additional line of street address information.

type.description: Enumeration of valid legal entity address type values.

LegalEntityAddressType.description: Enumeration of valid Legal Entity Address Type values.

Includes19.description:
All - Include all data


    BusinessNames - Include business names (e.g. type, name)

isAssignmentWorkLocationEnabled.description: Indicates whether assignment work location is enabled for the legal entity.

 Provides link to the associated Legal Entity information.

code.description: Unique deduction code set at legal entity or tenant level.

description.description: Description of the deduction code.

type.description: Enumeration of valid types of legal entity deduction values.

rate.description: Percentage-based amount that may vary by deduction type.

frequency.description: Enumeration of valid legal entity deduction frequency values.

isOnW2.description: Whether legal entity deduction shows up on a W-2 tax form.

onHold.description: Whether legal entity deduction should appear on paychecks.

effectiveStartDate.description:
Date the legal entity deduction take effect.
Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

Department.description: The Client Department model represents client department information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the department in Paycor's system. Generated by Paycor.

description.description: User defined description of the department.

parentId.description:
Unique identifier of the department's parent department in Paycor's system.
Value will be NULL for top level departments.
Level 2 Departments do not have ParentID's.

level.description:
The level of the department in the department structure.
Level 1 Department is the parent payroll for the pay group. Hence, Level will always be >= 2 for bulk/list api.

payrollId.description: Id of the parent payroll for the pay group.

payrollDescription.description: Description of the parent payroll for the pay group.

workLocationId.description: Unique identifier of the legal entity's work location in Paycor's system. Generated by Paycor.

workLocationName.description: Name of the legal entity's work location.
workLocationName.example: ACME East is an open concept office.

Department2.description: The Department model represents legal entity department information.

code.description: User defined department code. Only numeric characters are allowed and the limit is 14 characters.

parentId.description:
Id of the parent department (or payroll) under which new department will be created.
When creating top level departments, payroll id should be used as parent id

description.description: User defined description of the department.

workLocationId.description:
The ID of the Work Location to associate with new department.
 * Must be an existing Work Location on the Legal Entity. Use API 'Get a list of Work Locations for a Legal Entity' to retrieve a list of valid IDs.

Department3.description: The Department model represents legal entity department information.

departmentId.description: Unique Identifier of the Department in Paycor's system.

code.description: User defined department code. Only numeric characters are allowed and the limit is 14 characters.

parentId.description:

When updating top level departments, payroll id should be used as parent id

description.description: User defined description of the department.

workLocationId.description:

 * Must be an existing Work Location on the Legal Entity. Use API 'Get a list of Work Locations for a Legal Entity' to retrieve a list of valid IDs.

isTransfer.description:
IsTransfer property serves as an indicator in identifying a transfer punch.
When set to 'true' this property designates a punch as a transfer punch.
To appropriately handle a transfer punch ensure that the 'PunchStatusType' is set to value 'Transfer' when sending a payload.
If 'PunchStatusType' is set to a value other then 'Transfer' and 'IsTransfer' is set to 'true', PunchStatusType value will get ignored in most of the cases.
Transfer punch is essential for tracking and management of employee transfers during the working hours.
Transfer punches find their use in scenarios where an employee undergoes a change in department or labor type.
By adding a transfer punch the application effectively captures these transitions
providing an overview of employee movements between different departments or labor types.

note.description:
Comments to describe the Punch.
Note when provided must be between 1 and 300 characters.

laborCodes.description: LaborCodes must either be empty or contain an array of valid LaborCategoryIds and LaborCodeIds.

When set to 'true' Hour Entry is created, if set to 'false' Hour Record is created.
Existing client policies are only applied to Hour Entries.
Default value will be false.

When set to 'true' this property designates a punch as a transfer punch.

providing an overview of employee movements between different departments or labor types.

Exact start date and time for this day. Time component is needed in case of partial time off (when IsPartial is true). This is local time of the associated employee.
StartTime cannot be older than one year.

endTime.description:
Exact end date and time for this day.  Time component is needed in case of partial time off (when IsPartial is true). This is local time of the associated employee.
EndTime cannot be older than one year.

isPartial.description: This represents whether the Time Off is either Partial or Full Day. If true then StartTime and EndTime values would be required.

Person.description:
Each Person is associated with one or more Employees within one Tenant. An Employee works for a single Legal Entity within the Tenant.  If a person works
for multiple Legal Entities within a Tenant, they will be associated with multiple Employee records - but will only have a single Person record in the Paycor system.
Provides links to the Person's associated Employee, Legal Entity and Tenant information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the person in Paycor's system. Generated by Paycor.

prefix.description: Enumeration of valid name prefix values.

suffix.description: Enumeration of valid name suffix values.

List of type EmergencyContactData containing a Person's emergency contacts data.
This data will only be available for Get Person (returns single Person object) APIs and will always be null for Get Persons (returns list of Person) APIs.

socialMediaData.description: List of type SocialMediaData containing the Person's social media information.

Available only if person's veteran status is 'true'.
             Format= YYYY-MM-DDTHH=MM=SSZ  (ISO-8601 standard)

isArmedForcesServiceMedalVeteran.description:
Whether person qualifies as a medal recipient per US protected veteran definitions.
Available only if person's veteran status is 'true'.

isDisabledVeteran.description:
Whether person qualifies as a disabled veteran per US protected veteran definitions.
Available only if person's veteran status is 'true'.

isOtherProtectedVeteran.description:
Whether person qualifies as an other protected veteran per US protected veteran definitions.
Available only if person's veteran status is 'true'.

isRecentlySeparatedVeteran.description:
Whether person qualifies as a recently separated veteran per US protected veteran definitions.
Available only if person's veteran status is 'true'.

isVietnamEra.description:
Whether person qualifies as a Vietnam era veteran per US protected veteran definitions.
Available only if person's veteran status is 'true'.

isSpecialDisabled.description:
A special disabled veteran is an individual who is legally approved for financial compensation
 in accordance with laws provided by the Veterans Administration for disabilities that are rated at least 30 percent. .

Tenant.description:
The Tenant model represents information about Tenant (company) level organization information.
Provides links to the associated Legal Entity information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the tenant in Paycor's system. Generated by Paycor.

legalEntities.description: URL to access the Legal Entity resource for information about the tenant's legal entities.

PagedResultOfTenantWorkLocation.description:
The Paged Result model enables pagination of results if maximum of 100 records per response is exceeded. Additional
results can be requested by providing calling the AdditionalResultsUrl endpoint containing the continuation token, or
by building your own URL using the provided continuation token.

hasMoreResults.description: Whether additional API result records exist on the Paycor system.

continuationToken.description:
Paycor generated token string which may be provided in a subsequent request to  release additional records past the maximum. 
Used when partner is building their own URL.

additionalResultsUrl.description: Provides URL to call with the continuation token included for additional results.

records.description: List of the API response records.

TenantWorkLocation.description:
The Tenant Work Location model represents information about Work Locations assigned by the Tenant.
Provides link to the associated Tenant's information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the tenant's work location in Paycor's system. Generated by Paycor.

name.description: Name of the tenant's work location.
name.example: ACME East is an open concept office.

addresses.description: List of type of (to change)  LegalEntityAddress containing the tenant's work location's addresses.

phones.description: List of type of Phone containing the tenant's work location's phone numbers.

tenant.description: URL to access the Tenant resource for information about the tenant.

Access-Token.description: You will need to Activate your Application and retrieve an Access Token (a JWT Bearer Token) before calling our APIs. Please login and refer to the Guides for Activation information. When using the 'Try API' feature online, type into the textbox: Bearer {your Access Token}.
Access-Token.name: Authorization

Apim-Subscription-Key.description: Provide the APIm subscription key that you wish to use. Please login and consult the Guides for more information on retrieving this.
Apim-Subscription-Key.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key

tags.name: Employee Pay Schedule
tags.description:
This API allows working with an employee's scheduled Pay Periods, which indicates when the employee was/will be paid (known as a payrun). 
* Note that Pay Schedule is unrelated to the employee's work schedule or timecard information. 
* The employee's actual pay dates may not match the Pay Schedule, depending on the payroll admin's processing. 
  * An employee may be excluded from scheduled payruns. 
  * An employee may also have Additional Payruns (such as for bonuses) - which this API will not return. 
* A given employee will have a default Pay Frequency (such as Biweekly), which will define the Pay Schedule calendar.
  * The employee's Pay Frequency is defined by the Paygroup they are assigned to. 
* This endpoint can be used to retrieve parameters for GET Employee Pay Stubs, although 'GET Legal Entity Paydata' would be more accurate for that.

tags.name: Employee (Legacy / Perform Time) Schedules
tags.description:
These APIs interact with Paycors Perform Time Scheduling system. They will only be available to customers with Perform Time Scheduling service
* Perform Time Scheduling (sometimes called Legacy Scheduling) stores basic information about Shifts
* The Public APIs do not communicate with the more powerful Paycor Scheduling system. For Paycor Scheduling please refer to the documentation under the Employee Scheduling section.

tags.name: Employee Scheduling
tags.description:
These APIs interact with Paycor Scheduling system.

In order to use these apis you must have either Paycor Scheduling or Paycor Scheduling Pro Service.

tags.name: Employee Time Card Punches
tags.description:
These APIs interact with Paycor's Perform Time system.
* They will only work with Perform Time-enabled clients - otherwise you will receive an error.
* These APIs will not work for Time on Demand or Attendance on Demand clients.

tags.name: Employee Time Off Accruals
tags.description:
Accruals are time-off benefits for employees that increase over time, and are updated when a payrun is run (the employee is paid). 
* Common plans include PTO, vacation time, sick time, and floating holidays. 
* Accrual types and plans are setup at the Tenant level in Paycor's UI by the HR Admin. 
* Each employee can participate in a number of individual Accrual plans. 
* This API is only available to legal entities with the 'Perform Accruals' service. It is not available to clients with the older 'Perform Time Off' service. There is a migration path available.

tags.name: Employee Time Off Plan Assignment
tags.description:
This API allows working with Time Off Plan assignments for Employees. 
* It will only work with 'Perform Accruals' service enabled clients.

tags.name: Time Off Requests
tags.description:
These APIs allow querying employees' requests to take time off.
* These APIs require the 'Perform Time Off' service.

tags.name: Legal Entity Time Data
tags.description:
These APIs interact with Paycor's Perform Time system.
* And will only work with 'Perform Time' service/product enabled clients - otherwise you will receive an error.

tags.name: Legal Entity Time Off Plans
tags.description: This API allows working with Time Off Plans.

tags.name: Legal Entity Time Off Types
tags.description: This API allows working with Time Off Types.
